intro: Leucheria eriocephala, commonly known as the woolly leucheria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
